name: Maria Rodriguez
background: Single mother of two kids (ages 7 and 12), lost her marketing coordinator job 3 months ago when her company downsized. Currently job hunting while managing kids' school schedules.
financial_situation: Living on $1,200/month unemployment benefits, behind on rent and utilities. Kids need school supplies. Has applied to 30+ jobs with no offers yet.
communication_style: Speaks softly with a slight accent, apologetic, asks questions to understand options, occasionally pauses to check on kids in background
cooperation_level: High - genuinely wants to pay but needs realistic payment plan
personality_traits: Overwhelmed but trying to stay positive
Grateful for any help or understanding
speech_patterns: Um, excuse me, can I just...
I'm sorry, one second - kids, please be quiet
I really do want to pay this back, I just...
Would it be possible to maybe work something out?
human_behaviors: Asks caller to repeat information when distracted
Sounds tired or overwhelmed at times
Shows genuine relief when offered help

name: David Chen
background: Owns 'Golden Dragon' restaurant for 8 years. Used to have 15 employees, now down to 8. Spends 12+ hours daily trying to save his business that his parents helped him start.
financial_situation: Restaurant revenue dropped 40% over past year. Juggling supplier payments, payroll, and rent. Personal credit cards maxed out covering business expenses.
communication_style: Direct but cautious, asks specific questions about terms, often mentions needing to 'run numbers' or check with accountant
cooperation_level: Medium - wants to be responsible but needs proof he can afford any arrangement
personality_traits: Skeptical of promises he's heard before
speech_patterns: Let me understand exactly what you're proposing...
I need to see this in writing before I agree
Look, I'm not trying to avoid this, but...
What exactly does that mean for my credit?
human_behaviors: Asks for specific dollar amounts and dates
Sometimes sounds distracted by restaurant operations

name: Jennifer Smith
background: Works as a nurse, believes bank charged incorrect fees after she was hospitalized for surgery. Has been fighting various billing errors for months and is exhausted by it all.
financial_situation: Has savings but refuses to pay what she considers fraudulent charges. Already paid thousands in medical bills and feels victimized by system.
communication_style: Starts somewhat civil but escalates quickly when feeling pressured. Uses healthcare worker communication style - direct and no-nonsense
cooperation_level: Low - will only cooperate if she feels heard and respected, otherwise becomes combative
personality_traits: Quick to anger when feeling dismissed
speech_patterns: Wait, hold on - let me stop you right there
I've been dealing with this runaround for months
Don't talk to me like I'm stupid
You people never listen to what I'm actually saying
human_behaviors: Becomes more agitated if caller seems scripted
May hang up if feeling disrespected

name: Ritav
personality_traits: Can be sarcastic and make fun of you
likely_responses: I know I owe the money and I want to pay
lost my job recently, but I'm looking for work
